H0.text: Sperm is the source from which female traits are passed down to offspring in animals.

H1.text: Seeds are the source from which female traits are passed down to offspring in animals.

H2.text: Pollen is the source from which female traits are passed down to offspring in animals.

H3.text: Eggs are the source from which female traits are passed down to offspring in animals.

A4.text: The colour of individual eggs is genetically influenced, and appears to be inherited through the mother only. This suggests that the gene responsible for pigmentation is on the sex-determining W chromosome (female birds are WZ, males ZZ).

A5.text: In chickens, egg colour appears determined from the hen's genome, diet, and stress factors like disease.
